   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test the behavior of gen_udp. Testing udp is really a very unfunny task,
   23: %% because udp is not deterministic.
   24: %%
   25: -module(gen_udp_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   28: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   29: 
   30: 
   31: %% XXX - we should pick a port that we _know_ is closed. That's pretty hard.
   32: -define(CLOSED_PORT, 6666).
   33: 
   34: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   35:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   36: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   37:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   38: 
   39: -export([
   40: 	 send_to_closed/1, send_to_empty/1, active_n/1,
   41: 	 buffer_size/1, binary_passive_recv/1, max_buffer_size/1, bad_address/1,
   42: 	 read_packets/1, recv_poll_after_active_once/1,
   43:          open_fd/1, connect/1, reconnect/1, implicit_inet6/1,
   44:          recvtos/1, recvtosttl/1, recvttl/1, recvtclass/1,
   45:          sendtos/1, sendtosttl/1, sendttl/1, sendtclass/1,
   46: 	 local_basic/1, local_basic_binary/1, local_unbound/1,
   47: 	 local_fdopen/1, local_fdopen_unbound/1, local_abstract/1,
   48:          recv_close/1,
   49: 	 socket_monitor1/1,
   50: 	 socket_monitor1_manys/1,
   51: 	 socket_monitor1_manyc/1,
   52: 	 socket_monitor1_demon_after/1,
   53: 	 socket_monitor2/1,
   54: 	 socket_monitor2_manys/1,
   55: 	 socket_monitor2_manyc/1,
   56: 	 otp_17492/1,
   57: 
   58:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   59:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv/1,
   60:          t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   61:          t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv/1,
   62: 
   63:          otp_18323_opts_processing/1,
   64:          otp_18323_open/1
   65: 
   66: 	]).
   67: 
   68: -include_lib("kernel/src/inet_int.hrl").
   69: 
   70: -define(TRY_TC(F), try_tc(F)).
   71:                
   72: suite() ->
   73:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   74:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   75: 
   76: all() -> 
   77:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
   78:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
   79:     %% applications on *all* machines.
   80:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
   81:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
   82:         true ->
   83:             [
   84:              {group, inet_backend_default},
   85:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
   86:              {group, inet_backend_socket}
   87:             ];
   88:         _ ->
   89:             [
   90:              {group, inet_backend_default}
   91:             ]
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: 
   95: groups() -> 
   96:     [
   97:      {inet_backend_default,   [], inet_backend_default_cases()},
   98:      {inet_backend_inet,      [], inet_backend_inet_cases()},
   99:      {inet_backend_socket,    [], inet_backend_socket_cases()},
  100: 
  101:      {recv_and_send_opts,     [], recv_and_send_opts_cases()},
  102:      {local,                  [], local_cases()},
  103:      {socket_monitor,         [], socket_monitor_cases()},
  104: 
  105:      {sockaddr,               [], sockaddr_cases()},
  106:      {otp18323,               [], otp18323_cases()}
  107:     ].
  108: 
  109: inet_backend_default_cases() ->
  110:     all_cases().
  111: 
  112: inet_backend_inet_cases() ->
  113:     all_cases().
  114: 
  115: inet_backend_socket_cases() ->
  116:     all_cases().
  117: 
  118: all_cases() ->
  119:     [
  120:      send_to_closed,
  121:      send_to_empty,
  122:      buffer_size,
  123:      binary_passive_recv,
  124:      max_buffer_size,
  125:      bad_address,
  126:      read_packets,
  127:      recv_poll_after_active_once,
  128:      open_fd,
  129:      connect,
  130:      reconnect,
  131:      implicit_inet6,
  132:      active_n,
  133:      {group, recv_and_send_opts},
  134:      {group, local},
  135:      recv_close,
  136:      {group, socket_monitor},
  137:      otp_17492,
  138:      {group, sockaddr},
  139:      {group, otp18323}
  140:     ].
  141: 
  142: recv_and_send_opts_cases() ->
  143:     [
  144:      recvtos, recvtosttl, recvttl, recvtclass,
  145:      sendtos, sendtosttl, sendttl, sendtclass
  146:     ].
  147: 
  148: local_cases() ->
  149:     [
  150:      local_basic,
  151:      local_basic_binary,
  152:      local_unbound,
  153:      local_fdopen,
  154:      local_fdopen_unbound,
  155:      local_abstract
  156:     ].
  157: 
  158: socket_monitor_cases() ->
  159:     [
  160:      socket_monitor1,
  161:      socket_monitor1_manys,
  162:      socket_monitor1_manyc,
  163:      socket_monitor1_demon_after,
  164:      socket_monitor2,
  165:      socket_monitor2_manys,
  166:      socket_monitor2_manyc
  167:     ].
  168: 
  169: sockaddr_cases() ->
  170:     [
  171:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  172:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in_send_recv,
  173:      t_simple_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv,
  174:      t_simple_link_local_sockaddr_in6_send_recv
  175:     ].
  176: 
  177: otp18323_cases() ->
  178:     [
  179:      otp_18323_opts_processing,
  180:      otp_18323_open
  181:     ].
  182: 
  183: 
  184: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  185: 
  186:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  187:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  188:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  189: 
  190:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  191:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  192:             SKIP;
  193: 
  194:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  195:             
  196:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  197:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  198:             
  199:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  200:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  201: 
  202:             Config1
  203:     end.
  204: 
  205: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  206: 
  207:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  208:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  209:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  210: 
  211:     %% Stop the local monitor
  212:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  213: 
  214:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  215: 
  216:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  217:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  218: 
  219:     Config1.
  220: 
  221: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  222:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  223: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  224:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  225:         true ->
  226:             %% The environment trumps us,
  227:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  228:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  229:         false ->
  230:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  231:     end;
  232: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  233:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  234:         true ->
  235:             %% The environment trumps us,
  236:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  237:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  238:         false ->
  239:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  240:     end;
  241: init_per_group(local, Config) -> 
  242:     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  243:        "is socket supported and is inet-backend = socket ?"),
  244:     case ?LIB:is_socket_supported() andalso ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  245:         true ->
  246:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] do we support 'local'?"),
  247:             case ?LIB:has_support_unix_domain_socket() of
  248:                 true ->
  249:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [socket] which platform?"),
  250:                     case os:type() of
  251:                         {win32, _} ->
  252:                             %% AF_LOCAL (AF_UNIX) is *not* (yet) supported
  253:                             %% for DGRAM (UDP) 
  254:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  255:                                "[socket,win32] 'local' not (currently) "
  256:                                "supported for DGRAM on windows"),
  257:                             {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  258:                         {OSF, _} ->
  259:                             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  260:                                "[socket,~w] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!",
  261:                                [OSF]),
  262:                             Config
  263:                     end;
  264:                 false ->
  265:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  266:             end;
  267:         false ->
  268:             ?P("init_per_group(local) -> [inet] do we support 'local'?"),
  269:             case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local]) of
  270:                 {ok,S} ->
  271:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  272:                        "[inet] we support (DGRAM) 'local'!"),
  273:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
  274:                     Config;
  275:                 {error, eafnosupport} ->
  276:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  277:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  278:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"};
  279:                 {error, {invalid, {domain, local}}} ->
  280:                     ?P("init_per_group(local) -> "
  281:                        "[inet] we *do not* support 'local'"),
  282:                     {skip, "AF_LOCAL not supported"}
  283:             end
  284:     end;
  285: init_per_group(sockaddr = _GroupName, Config) ->
  286:     ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> do we support 'socket'"),
  287:     try socket:info() of
  288: 	_ ->
  289:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we support 'socket'"),
  290:             Config
  291:     catch
  292:         error : notsup ->
  293:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> we *do not* support 'socket'"),
  294:             {skip, "esock not supported"};
  295:         error : undef ->
  296:             ?P("init_per_group(sockaddr) -> 'socket' not configured"),
  297:             {skip, "esock not configured"}
  298:     end;
  299: init_per_group(otp18323 = _GroupName, Config) ->
  300:     ?P("init_per_group(otp18323) -> inet-drv specific bug(s)"),
  301:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  302:         true ->
  303:             {skip, "Inet Drv specific bugs"};
  304:         false ->
  305:             ok
  306:     end;
  307: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  308:     Config.
  309: 
  310: end_per_group(local, _Config) ->
  311:     delete_local_filenames();
  312: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  313:     Config.
  314: 
  315: 
  316: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) ->
  317:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  318:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  319:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  320:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  321:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  322:        [Config0, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  323: 
  324:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  325: 
  326:     Config1 = init_per_testcase2(Case, Config0),
  327: 
  328:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  329:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  330:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  331:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  332:     Config1.
  333: 
  334: init_per_testcase2(read_packets, Config) ->
  335:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 2}),
  336:     Config;
  337: init_per_testcase2(_Case, Config) ->
  338:     Config.
  339: 
  340: 
  341: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  342:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  343:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  344:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  345:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  346:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  347:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  348: 
  349:     ?P("system events during test: "
  350:        "~n   ~p", [kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events()]),
  351: 
  352:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  353:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  354:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  355:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  356:     ok.
  357: 
  358: 
  359: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  360: %% Send two packets to a closed port (on some systems this causes the socket
  361: %% to be closed).
  362: 
  363: %% Tests core functionality.
  364: send_to_closed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  365:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_send_to_closed(Config) end).
  366: 
  367: do_send_to_closed(Config) ->
  368:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  369:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  370:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  371:     timer:sleep(2),
  372:     ok = gen_udp:send(Sock, Addr, ?CLOSED_PORT, "foo"),
  373:     ok = gen_udp:close(Sock),
  374:     ok.
  375: 
  376: 
  377: 
  378: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  379: %% Send to the empty host name
  380: 
  381: send_to_empty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  382:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_send_to_empty(Config) end).
  383: 
  384: do_send_to_empty(Config) ->
  385:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  386:     element(1, os:type()) =:= unix andalso
  387:         begin
  388:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, "", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  389:             {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx")
  390:         end,
  391:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  392:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:send(Sock, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT, "xXx"),
  393:     ok.
  394: 
  395: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  396: %% Test that the UDP socket buffer sizes are settable
  397: 
  398: %% Test UDP buffer size setting.
  399: buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  400:     Cond = fun() ->
  401:                    case os:type() of
  402:                        {win32, nt} ->
  403:                            case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  404:                                true ->
  405:                                    {skip, "TC not compliant with socket (yet)"};
  406:                                false ->
  407:                                    ok
  408:                            end;
  409:                        _ ->
  410:                            ok
  411:                    end
  412:            end,
  413:     TC   = fun() -> do_buffer_size(Config) end,
  414:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, TC).
  415: 
  416: do_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  417:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  418:     ClientIP = Addr,
  419:     ServerIP = Addr,
  420:     Len = 256,
  421:     Bin = list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, Len-1)),
  422:     M = 8192 div Len,
  423:     SAFE = 3,
  424:     LONG = 1,
  425:     Spec0 =
  426: 	[
  427:          {opt, M},   {safe, M   - SAFE}, {long, M   + LONG},
  428: 	 {opt, 2*M}, {safe, 2*M - SAFE}, {long, 2*M + LONG},
  429: 	 {opt, 4*M}, {safe, 4*M - SAFE}, {long, 4*M + LONG}
  430:         ],
  431:     Spec =
  432: 	[case Tag of
  433: 	     opt ->
  434: 		 [{recbuf,Val*Len},{sndbuf,(Val + 2)*Len}];
  435: 	     safe ->
  436: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  437: 		  [correct]};
  438: 	     long ->
  439: 		 {list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Val, Bin)),
  440: 		  [truncated,emsgsize,timeout]}
  441: 	 end || {Tag,Val} <- Spec0],
  442:     %%
  443:     {ok, ClientSocket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ClientIP}]),
  444:     {ok, ClientPort}   = inet:port(ClientSocket),
  445:     Client = self(),
  446:     ?P("Client: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ClientIP, ClientPort, ClientSocket]),
  447:     Server =
  448: 	spawn_link(
  449: 	  fun () ->
  450:                   ?P("buffer_size[server] -> starting"),
  451: 		  {ok, ServerSocket} =
  452:                       ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, ServerIP}]),
  453: 		  {ok, ServerPort}   =
  454:                       inet:port(ServerSocket),
  455: 		  Client ! {self(),port,ServerPort},
  456: 		  buffer_size_server(Client, ClientIP, ClientPort, 
  457: 				     ServerSocket, 1, Spec),
  458: 		  ok = gen_udp:close(ServerSocket)
  459: 	  end),
  460:     Mref = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
  461:     receive
  462: 	{Server, port, ServerPort} ->
  463:             ?P("Server: {~p, ~p}, ~p", [ServerIP, ServerPort, Server]),
  464: 	    buffer_size_client(Server, ServerIP, ServerPort,
  465: 			       ClientSocket, 1, Spec)
  466:     end,
  467:     ok = gen_udp:close(ClientSocket),
  468:     receive
  469: 	{'DOWN',Mref,_,_,normal} ->
  470: 	    ok
  471:     end.
  472: 
  473: buffer_size_client(_, _, _, _, _, []) ->
  474:     ok;
  475: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  476: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  477:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  478:        "~n   Opts: ~p", [Cnt, Opts]),
  479:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  480:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  481:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> options after set: "
  482:        "~n   ~p", [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts)]),
  483:     Server ! {self(),setopts,Cnt},
  484:     receive {Server,setopts,Cnt} -> ok end,
  485:     buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  486: buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, 
  487: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,Replies}|T]=Opts) when is_binary(B) ->
  488:     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> entry with"
  489:        "~n   send size:   ~w"
  490:        "~n   expecting:   ~p"
  491:        "~nwhen"
  492:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  493:        [Cnt, byte_size(B), Replies, inet:info(Socket)]),
  494:     case gen_udp:send(Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt,B/binary>>) of
  495: 	ok ->
  496: 	    receive
  497: 		{Server, Cnt, Reply} ->
  498:                     ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  499:                        "~n   Reply: ~p", [Cnt, Reply]),
  500: 		    Tag =
  501:                         case Reply of
  502:                             %% {completion_status, #{info := Tag0}}
  503:                             %%   when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  504:                             %%     Tag0;
  505:                             %% {completion_status, Tag0} when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  506:                             %%     Tag0;
  507:                             {Tag0, _} ->
  508:                                 Tag0;
  509:                             Tag0 when is_atom(Tag0) ->
  510:                                 Tag0
  511:                         end,
  512: 		    case lists:member(Tag, Replies) of
  513: 			true -> ok;
  514: 			false ->
  515:                             ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> "
  516:                                "missing from expected replies: "
  517:                                "~n   Tag:     ~p"
  518:                                "~n   Replies: ~p", [Cnt, Tag, Replies]),
  519: 			    ct:fail({reply_mismatch,Cnt,Reply,Replies,
  520: 				     byte_size(B),
  521: 				     inet:getopts(Socket,
  522: 						  [sndbuf,recbuf])})
  523: 		    end,
  524: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T)
  525: 	    after 1313 ->
  526:                     %% ?P("buffer_size_client(~w) -> timeout", [Cnt]),
  527: 		    buffer_size_client(Server, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt, Opts)
  528: 	    end;
  529: 
  530: 	{error, enobufs = Reason} ->
  531: 	    ?P("<WARNING> send failed with '~w' - system overload => SKIP"),
  532: 	    ?SKIPE(Reason);
  533: 
  534: 	{error, Reason} ->
  535: 	    ?P("<ERROR> Client failed sending ~w bytes of data: "
  536: 	       "~n   SndBuf: ~p"
  537: 	       "~n   Reason: ~p",
  538: 	       [byte_size(B), inet:getopts(Socket, [sndbuf]), Reason]),
  539: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  540:     end.
  541: 
  542: buffer_size_server(_, _, _, _, _, []) -> 
  543:     ok;
  544: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  545: 		   Socket, Cnt, [Opts|T]) when is_list(Opts) ->
  546:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when await client setopts", [Cnt]),
  547:     receive {Client, setopts, Cnt} -> ok end,
  548:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> setopts with "
  549:        "~n   Opts:        ~p"
  550:        "~nwhen"
  551:        "~n   Socket info: ~p", [Cnt, Opts, inet:info(Socket)]),
  552:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, Opts),
  553:     GOpts = [K || {K, _} <- Opts],
  554:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> options after set: "
  555:        "~n                ~p"
  556:        "~nwhen"
  557:        "~n   Socket info: ~p",
  558:        [Cnt, inet:getopts(Socket, GOpts), inet:info(Socket)]),
  559:     Client ! {self(), setopts, Cnt},
  560:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T);
  561: buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, 
  562: 		   Socket, Cnt, [{B,_}|T]) when is_binary(B) ->
  563:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> entry when"
  564:        "~n   expect ~w bytes of data"
  565:        "~nwhen"
  566:        "~n   Socket info: ~p"
  567:        "~n   MQ:          ~p", [Cnt, byte_size(B), inet:info(Socket), mq()]),
  568:     Reply = case buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) of
  569:                 D when is_binary(D) ->
  570:                     SizeD = byte_size(D),
  571:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received: ~w bytes of data"
  572:                       "~nwhen"
  573:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, SizeD, inet:info(Socket)]),
  574:                     case B of
  575:                         D ->
  576:                             correct;
  577:                         <<D:SizeD/binary,_/binary>> ->
  578:                             truncated;
  579:                         _ ->
  580:                             {unexpected,D}
  581:                     end;
  582:                 Error ->
  583:                     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error:"
  584:                        "~n                ~p"
  585:                        "~nwhen"
  586:                        "~n   Socket Info: ~p",
  587:                        [Cnt, Error, inet:info(Socket)]),
  588:                     Error
  589:             end,
  590:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> send reply '~p' when"
  591:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Reply, inet:info(Socket)]),
  592:     Client ! {self(), Cnt, Reply},
  593:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
  594:     buffer_size_server(Client, IP, Port, Socket, Cnt+1, T).
  595: 
  596: buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt) ->
  597:     ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> await data: "
  598:        "~n   Socket:      ~p"
  599:        "~n   IP:          ~p"
  600:        "~n   Port:        ~p"
  601:        "~nwhen"
  602:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Cnt, Socket, IP, Port, inet:info(Socket)]),
  603:     receive
  604: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<Cnt, B/binary>>} ->
  605:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received ~w bytes",
  606:                [Cnt, byte_size(B)]),
  607: 	    B;
  608: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, <<_B/binary>>} ->
  609:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected ~w bytes",
  610:                [Cnt, byte_size(_B)]),
  611: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  612: 
  613: 	{udp, Socket, IP, Port, _CRAP} ->
  614:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected crap", [Cnt]),
  615: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  616: 
  617: 	{udp, XSocket, XIP, XPort, _CRAP} ->
  618:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected udp message: "
  619:                "~n   XSocket: ~p"
  620:                "~n   Socket:  ~p"
  621:                "~n   XIP:     ~p"
  622:                "~n   IP:      ~p"
  623:                "~n   XPort:   ~p"
  624:                "~n   Port:    ~p",
  625:                [Cnt, XSocket, Socket, XIP, IP, XPort, Port]),
  626: 	    buffer_size_server_recv(Socket, IP, Port, Cnt);
  627: 
  628: 	{udp_closed, Socket} ->
  629:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> received unexpected 'closed'", [Cnt]),
  630: 	    closed;
  631: 
  632: 	{udp_error, Socket, Error} ->
  633:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> error: "
  634:                "~n   ~p", [Cnt, Error]),
  635:             ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, true}]),
  636: 	    Error
  637: 
  638:     after 5000 ->
  639:             ?P("buffer_size_server(~w) -> timeout: "
  640:                "~n   Socket:       ~p"
  641:                "~n   Socket Info:  ~p"
  642:                "~n   Process Info: ~p",
  643:                [Cnt,
  644:                 Socket, inet:info(Socket), erlang:process_info(self())]),
  645: 	    {timeout, mq()}
  646:     end.
  647: 
  648: 
  649: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  650: %% OTP-15206: Keep buffer small for udp
  651: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  652: max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  653:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_max_buffer_size(Config) end).
  654: 
  655: do_max_buffer_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  656:     ?P("create socket"),
  657:     {ok, Socket} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary]),
  658:     ?P("get buffers"),
  659:     {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf0}, {buffer, Buffer0}]} =
  660:         inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]),
  661:     ?P("buffers: "
  662:        "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  663:        "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf0, Buffer0]),
  664:     NewRecBuf = 1 bsl 20,
  665:     ?P("set recbuf: ~w", [NewRecBuf]),
  666:     ok = inet:setopts(Socket, [{recbuf, NewRecBuf}]),
  667:     ?P("get buffers"),
  668:     case inet:getopts(Socket, [recbuf, buffer]) of
  669:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, 65536 = Buffer}]} ->
  670:             ?P("buffers: expected"
  671:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  672:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  673:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  674:             ok;
  675:         {ok, [{recbuf, RecBuf}, {buffer, Buffer}]} ->
  676:             ?P("buffers: unexpected"
  677:                "~n   RecBuf: ~p"
  678:                "~n   Buffer: ~p", [RecBuf, Buffer]),
  679:             gen_udp:close(Socket),
  680:             ct:fail({unexpected_buffer_size, Buffer});
  681:         {error, Reason} ->
  682:             ?P("failed extracting buffers"
  683:                "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
  684:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
  685:             ct:fail({unexpected_getopts_error, Reason})
  686:     end,
  687:     ?P("done"),
  688:     ok.
  689:             
  690: 
  691: 
  692: 
  693: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  694: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode
  695: %%
  696: 
  697: %% OTP-3823 gen_udp:recv does not return address in binary mode.
  698: binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  699:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_binary_passive_recv(Config) end).
  700: 
  701: do_binary_passive_recv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  702:     D1       = "The quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog",
  703:     D2       = list_to_binary(D1),
  704:     D3       = ["The quick", <<" brown ">>, "fox jumps ", <<"over ">>,
  705: 		<<>>, $a, [[], " lazy ", <<"dog">>]],
  706:     D2       = iolist_to_binary(D3),
  707:     B        = D2,
  708:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  709:     ?P("open receive socket"),
  710:     {ok, R}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {active, false}, {debug, true}]),
  711:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{debug, false}]),
  712:     {ok, RP} = inet:port(R),
  713:     ?P("open send socket"),
  714:     {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  715:     {ok, SP} = inet:port(S),
  716:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a list)", [RP, length(D1)]),
  717:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D1),
  718:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  719:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  720:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a binary)", [RP, byte_size(D2)]),
  721:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D2),
  722:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  723:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  724:     ?P("try send (to port ~w) ~w bytes (as a iolist)", [RP, iolist_size(D3)]),
  725:     ok       = gen_udp:send(S, Addr, RP, D3),
  726:     ?P("try recv (from port ~w) ~w bytes", [SP, byte_size(B)+1]),
  727:     {ok, {Addr, SP, B}} = gen_udp:recv(R, byte_size(B)+1),
  728:     ?P("cleanup"),
  729:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  730:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  731:     ?P("done"),
  732:     ok.
  733: 
  734: 
  735: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  736: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  737: 
  738: %% OTP-3836 inet_udp crashes when IP-address is larger than 255.
  739: bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  740:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_bad_address(Config) end).
  741: 
  742: do_bad_address(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  743:     ?P("create sockets"),
  744:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  745:     {ok, RP}  = inet:port(R),
  746:     {ok, S}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
  747:     {ok, _SP} = inet:port(S),
  748: 
  749:     ?P("try send to invalid address 1 - expect failure"),
  750:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,1,0}, RP, "void")) of
  751:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  752:             ok;
  753:         Any1 ->
  754:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  755:                "~n   ~p", [Any1]),
  756:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 1, Any1})                
  757:     end,
  758: 
  759:     ?P("try send to invalid address 2 - expect failure"),
  760:     case (catch gen_udp:send(S, {127,0,0,256}, RP, "void")) of
  761:         {'EXIT', badarg} ->
  762:             ok;
  763:         Any2 ->
  764:             ?P("<ERROR> unexpected result: "
  765:                "~n   ~p", [Any2]),
  766:             ct:fail({unexpected_result, 2, Any2})
  767:     end,
  768: 
  769:     ?P("cleanup"),
  770:     ok       = gen_udp:close(S),
  771:     ok       = gen_udp:close(R),
  772: 
  773:     ?P("done"),
  774:     ok.
  775: 
  776: 
  777: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
  778: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads
  779: %%
  780: %% Starts a node that on command sends a bunch of messages
  781: %% to our UDP port. The receiving process just receives and
  782: %% ignores the incoming messages.
  783: %% A tracing process traces the receiving port for
  784: %% 'send' and scheduling events. From the trace,
  785: %% how many messages are received per in/out scheduling,
  786: %% which should never be more than the read_packet parameter.
  787: 
  788: %% OTP-6249 UDP option for number of packet reads.
  789: read_packets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  790:     Cond = fun() ->
  791: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
  792: 		       true ->
  793:                            %% We have not (yet) implemented support for 
  794:                            %% this option. We accept it but do not use it.
  795: 			   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
  796: 		       false ->
  797: 			   ok
  798: 		   end
  799: 	   end,
  800:     TC   = fun() ->
  801:                    ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  802:                    Res = do_read_packets(Config),
  803:                    ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  804:                    Res
  805:            end,
  806:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, TC).
  807: 
  808: do_read_packets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  809:     N1   = 5,
  810:     N2   = 1,
  811:     Msgs = 30000,
  812:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  813:     ?P("open socket (with read-packets: ~p)", [N1]),
  814:     {ok, R}   = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {read_packets,N1}]),
  815:     {ok, {RA, RP}}  = inet:sockname(R),
  816:     ?P("reader: "
  817:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  818:        "~n   Port: ~p", [RA, RP]),
  819: 
  820:     ?P("create slave node"),
  821:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  822:     %%
  823:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  824:     {V1, Trace1} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  825:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N1]),
  826:     {ok,[{read_packets,N1}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  827:     %%
  828:     ?P("set new read-packets: ~p", [N2]),
  829:     ok = inet:setopts(R, [{read_packets, N2}]),
  830:     ?P("perform read-packets test"),
  831:     {V2, Trace2} = read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node),
  832:     ?P("verify read-packets (to ~w)", [N2]),
  833:     {ok, [{read_packets,N2}]} = inet:getopts(R, [read_packets]),
  834:     %%
  835:     ?P("stop slave node"),
  836:     peer:stop(Peer),
  837:     ?P("dump trace 1"),
  838:     dump_terms(Config, "trace1.terms", Trace1),
  839:     ?P("dump trace 2"),
  840:     dump_terms(Config, "trace2.terms", Trace2),
  841: 
  842:     %% Because of the inherit racy-ness of the feature it is
  843:     %% hard to test that it behaves correctly.
  844:     %% Right now (OTP 21) a port task takes 5% of the
  845:     %% allotted port task reductions to execute, so
  846:     %% the max number of executions a port is allowed to
  847:     %% do before being re-scheduled is N * 20
  848: 
  849:     ?P("read-packets test verification when: "
  850:        "~n      N1: ~p"
  851:        "~n      V1: ~p"
  852:        "~n   vs"
  853:        "~n      N2: ~p"
  854:        "~n      V2: ~p", [N1, V1, N2, V2]),
  855:     if
  856:         V1 > (N1 * 20) ->
  857:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V1, N1]);
  858:         V2 > (N2 * 20) ->
  859:             ct:fail("Got ~p msgs, max was ~p", [V2, N2]);
  860:         true ->
  861:             ok
  862:     end,
  863:     ?P("done"),
  864:     ok.
  865: 
  866: dump_terms(Config, Name, Terms) ->
  867:     FName = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),Name),
  868:     file:write_file(FName, term_to_binary(Terms)),
  869:     ct:log("Logged terms to ~s",[FName]).
  870: 
  871: read_packets_test(Config, R, RA, RP, Msgs, Node) ->
  872:     Receiver = self(),
  873:     Tracer =
  874: 	spawn_link(
  875: 	  fun () ->
  876: 		  receive
  877: 		      {Receiver,get_trace} ->
  878: 			  Receiver ! {self(),{trace,flush()}}
  879: 		  end
  880: 	  end),
  881:     Sender =
  882: 	spawn_opt(
  883: 	  Node,
  884: 	  fun () ->
  885:                   %% We run on the same "machine" as R,
  886:                   %% so use the same addr
  887: 		  {ok, S}  = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, RA}]),
  888: 		  {ok, {SA, SP}} = inet:sockname(S),
  889: 		  Receiver ! {self(),{sockname, {SA, SP}}},
  890: 		  receive
  891: 		      {Receiver,go} ->
  892: 			  read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs)
  893: 		  end
  894: 	  end, 
  895: 	  [link,{priority,high}]),
  896:     receive
  897: 	{Sender, {sockname, {SA, SP}}} ->
  898: 	    erlang:trace(R, true,
  899: 			 [running_ports,'send',{tracer,Tracer}]),
  900: 	    erlang:yield(),
  901: 	    Sender ! {Receiver,go},
  902: 	    read_packets_recv(Msgs),
  903: 	    erlang:trace(R, false, [all]),
  904: 	    Tracer ! {Receiver,get_trace},
  905: 	    receive
  906: 		{Tracer,{trace,Trace}} ->
  907: 		    {read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace), Trace}
  908: 	    end
  909:     end.
  910: 
  911: read_packets_send(_S, _RA, _RP, 0) ->
  912:     ok;
  913: read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs) ->
  914:     ok = gen_udp:send(S, RA, RP, "UDP FLOOOOOOD"),
  915:     read_packets_send(S, RA, RP, Msgs - 1).
  916: 
  917: read_packets_recv(0) ->
  918:     ok;
  919: read_packets_recv(N) ->
  920:     receive
  921: 	_ ->
  922: 	    read_packets_recv(N - 1)
  923:     after 5000 ->
  924: 	    timeout
  925:     end.
  926: 
  927: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace) ->
  928:     [Max | _] = Pkts =
  929:         lists:reverse(lists:sort(read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0))),
  930:     ?P("read-packets verify: ~p", [lists:sublist(Pkts,10)]),
  931:     Max.
  932: 
  933: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace,R,OutIn,_}|Trace], M) 
  934:   when OutIn =:= out; OutIn =:= in ->
  935:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
  936: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [{trace, R,'receive',timeout}|Trace], M) ->
  937:     push(M, read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, 0));
  938: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP,
  939: 		    [{trace,R,'send',{udp, R, SA, SP,_Msg}, Self} | Trace], M)
  940:   when Self =:= self() ->
  941:     read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, Trace, M+1);
  942: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, [], M) ->
  943:     push(M, []);
  944: read_packets_verify(R, SA, SP, [T | Trace], M) ->
  945:     ct:fail(
  946:       {read_packets_verify, mismatch, self(),
  947:        {R, SA, SP, [T, length(Trace)], M}});
  948: read_packets_verify(_R, _SA, _SP, Trace, M) ->
  949:     ct:fail({read_packets_verify,mismatch,Trace,M}).
  950: 
  951: push(0, Vs) ->
  952:     Vs;
  953: push(V, Vs) ->
  954:     [V|Vs].
  955: 
  956: flush() ->
  957:     receive
  958: 	X ->
  959: 	    [X|flush()]
  960:     after 200 ->
  961: 	    []
  962:     end.
  963: 
  964: 
  965: %% OTP-16059
  966: %% UDP recv with timeout 0 corrupts internal state so that after a
  967: %% recv under {active, once} the UDP recv poll wastes incoming data
  968: recv_poll_after_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  969:     Msg1 = <<"Hej!">>,
  970:     Msg2 = <<"Hej igen!">>,
  971:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
  972:     %% Addr = {127,0,0,1},
  973:     {ok,S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, once}]),
  974:     {ok,P1} = inet:port(S1),
  975:     {ok,S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
  976:     {ok,P2} = inet:port(S2),
  977:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg1),
  978:     receive
  979:         {udp, S1, Addr, P2, Msg1} ->
  980:             {error, timeout} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
  981:             ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, Msg2),
  982:             receive after 500 -> ok end, % Give the kernel time to deliver
  983:             {ok, {Addr, P2, Msg2}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, 0),
  984:             ok
  985:     end.
  986: 
  987: 
  988: %% Test that the 'fd' option works.
  989: open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  990:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  991:             fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
  992:             fun() -> do_open_fd(Config) end).
  993: 
  994: do_open_fd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  995:     Msg = "Det gör ont när knoppar brista. Varför skulle annars våren tveka?",
  996:     Addr = {127,0,0,1},
  997:     ?P("try open first (default domain = inet) socket and get its fd"),
  998:     {S1, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0) of
  999:                    {ok, Sock1} when is_port(Sock1) ->
 1000:                        {ok, FileDesc1} = prim_inet:getfd(Sock1),
 1001:                        {Sock1, FileDesc1};
 1002:                    {ok, Sock1} ->
 1003:                       {ok, [{fd, FileDesc1}]} =
 1004:                           gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock1, [fd]),
 1005:                       {Sock1, FileDesc1}
 1006:                end,
 1007:     ?P("try get the socket port number"),
 1008:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S1),
 1009: 
 1010:     ?P("try open second (domain = inet6) socket with FD = ~w "
 1011:        "and expect *failure*", [FD]),
 1012: 
 1013:     case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [inet6, {fd,FD}]) of
 1014:         {error, einval = Reason} ->
 1015:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w", [Reason]),
 1016:             ok;
 1017:         {error, eafnosupport = Reason} ->
 1018:             ?P("expected failure reason ~w (IPv6 not supported?)", [Reason]),
 1019:             ok;
 1020:         {error, Reason} ->
 1021:             ?P("unexpected failure: ~w", [Reason]),
 1022:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, Reason});
 1023:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1024:             ?P("unexpected success: "
 1025:                "~n   ~p", [inet:info(Socket)]),
 1026:             (catch gen_udp:close(Socket)),
 1027:             (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1028:             ct:fail(unexpected_succes)
 1029:     end,
 1030: 
 1031:     ?P("try open second socket with FD = ~w "
 1032:        "and expect success", [FD]),
 1033:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}]),
 1034:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1035: 
 1036:     ?P("try open third socket and expect success"),
 1037:     {ok, S3} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1038:     {ok, P3} = inet:port(S3),
 1039: 
 1040:     ?P("try send message from socket 3 to socket 2 (~w)", [P2]),
 1041:     ok = gen_udp:send(S3, Addr, P2, Msg),
 1042:     receive
 1043: 	{udp, S2, Addr, P3, Msg} ->
 1044:             ?P("expected recv - "
 1045:                "try send message from socket 2 to socket 3 (~w)", [P3]),
 1046: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P3, Msg),
 1047: 	    receive
 1048: 		{udp, S3, Addr, P2, Msg} ->
 1049:                     ?P("expected recv - done"),
 1050: 		    ok
 1051: 	    after 1000 ->
 1052:                     ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1053: 		    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1054: 	    end
 1055:     after 1000 ->
 1056:             ?P("unexpected timeout"),
 1057: 	    ct:fail(io_lib:format("~w", [flush()]))
 1058:     end,
 1059:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1060:     (catch gen_udp:close(S3)),
 1061:     (catch gen_udp:close(S2)),
 1062:     (catch gen_udp:close(S1)),
 1063:     ?P("done"),
 1064:     ok.
 1065: 
 1066: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1067:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_active_n(Config) end).
 1068: 
 1069: do_active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1070:     N = 3,
 1071:     ?P("create socket (1) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1072:     {ok, Addr} = ?LIB:which_local_addr(inet),
 1073:     S1 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1074:     ?P("verify socket active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1075:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1076: 
 1077:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect passive", [-N]),
 1078:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-N}]),
 1079:     receive
 1080:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1081:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1082:             ok
 1083:     after
 1084:         5000 ->
 1085:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1086:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1087:     end,
 1088:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1089:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1090: 
 1091:     ?P("set active = 0 and expect passive message"),
 1092:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active, 0}]),
 1093:     receive
 1094:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1095:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1096:             ok
 1097:     after
 1098:         5000 ->
 1099:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1100:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1101:     end,
 1102: 
 1103:     ?P("set active = 32767 (=max) and expect success"),
 1104:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32767}]),
 1105:     ?P("try set active = 1 (already at max) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1106:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,1}]),
 1107:     ?P("set active = -32769 (<min) and expect failure (einval)"),
 1108:     {error, einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32769}]),
 1109:     ?P("set active = -32768 and expect passive message"),
 1110:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,-32768}]),
 1111:     receive
 1112:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1113:             ?P("expected passive received"),
 1114:             ok
 1115:     after
 1116:         5000 ->
 1117:             ?P("ERROR: passive *not* received"),
 1118:             exit({error,udp_passive_failure})
 1119:     end,
 1120: 
 1121:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false), (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1122:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1123:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1124:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1125:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [true]),
 1126:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,true}]),
 1127:     ?P("verify socket active active (=true) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1128:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1129:     ?P("verify nothing in the message queue"),
 1130:     receive
 1131:         Unexpected_1 ->
 1132:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1133:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_1]),
 1134:             exit({error, active_n, Unexpected_1})
 1135:     after
 1136:         0 ->
 1137:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1138:             ok
 1139:     end,
 1140: 
 1141:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1142:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1143:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [once]),
 1144:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,once}]),
 1145:     ?P("verify socket active active (=once) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1146:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1147:     receive
 1148:         Unexpected_2 ->
 1149:             ?P("ERROR: something in the message queue: "
 1150:                "~n   ~p", [Unexpected_2]),
 1151:             exit({error,active_n, Unexpected_2})
 1152:     after
 1153:         0 ->
 1154:             ?P("nothing in the message queue"),
 1155:             ok
 1156:     end,
 1157: 
 1158:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect failure (einval)", [32768]),
 1159:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,32768}]),
 1160:     ?P("set active = ~w and expect success", [false]),
 1161:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,false}]),
 1162:     ?P("verify socket active passive (=false) (~p)", [which_info(S1)]),
 1163:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1164: 
 1165:      %% S1Port = ok(inet:port(S1)),
 1166:     {S1Addr, S1Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S1)),
 1167:     ?P("S1 sockname: "
 1168:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1169:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S1Addr, S1Port]),
 1170: 
 1171:     ?P("create socket (2) with active = ~w", [N]),
 1172:     S2 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,N}])),
 1173: 
 1174:     %% S2Port = ok(inet:port(S2)),
 1175:     {S2Addr, S2Port} = ok(inet:sockname(S2)),
 1176:     ?P("S2 sockname: "
 1177:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1178:        "~n   Port: ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port]),
 1179: 
 1180:     ?P("verify socket (2) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S2)]),
 1181:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active])),
 1182:     ?P("set socket (1) active = ~w and expect success", [N]),
 1183:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{active,N}]),
 1184:     ?P("verify socket (1) active = ~w (~p)", [N, which_info(S1)]),
 1185:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active])),
 1186:     ?P("generate ~w message(s) and send them: S1 -> S2 and S2 -> S1 when:"
 1187:        "~n   Socket 1 info: ~p"
 1188:        "~n   Socket 2 info: ~p", [N, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1189:     lists:foreach(
 1190:       fun(I) ->
 1191:               Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1192:               ?P("send message ~w from S2 to S1 (~p, ~w):"
 1193:                  "~n   S1 info: ~p"
 1194:                  "~n   S2 info: ~p",
 1195:                  [I, S1Addr, S1Port, inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2)]),
 1196:               case gen_udp:send(S2, S1Addr, S1Port, Msg) of
 1197:                   ok ->
 1198:                       ok;
 1199:                   {error, Reason} = ERROR ->
 1200:                       ?P("Failed sending message ~w: "
 1201:                          "~n   ~p", [N, Reason]),
 1202:                       exit(ERROR)
 1203:               end,
 1204:               ?P("expect message on S1"),
 1205:               receive
 1206:                   {udp, S1, _, S2Port, Msg} ->
 1207:                       ?P("expected message received on S1 - "
 1208:                          "send message back: from S1 to S2 (~p, ~w): "
 1209:                          "~n   ~p", [S2Addr, S2Port, inet:info(S1)]),
 1210:                       ok = gen_udp:send(S1, S2Addr, S2Port, Msg)
 1211:               after
 1212:                   5000 ->
 1213:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S1)"),
 1214:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1215:               end,
 1216:               ?P("expect message on S2"),
 1217:               receive
 1218:                   {udp, S2, _, S1Port, Msg} ->
 1219:                       ?P("expected message received on S2: "
 1220:                          "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1221:                       ok
 1222:               after
 1223:                   5000 ->
 1224:                       ?P("ERROR: received nothing (->S2)"),
 1225:                       exit({error,timeout})
 1226:               end
 1227:       end, lists:seq(1,N)),
 1228:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (1)"),
 1229:     receive
 1230:         {udp_passive, S1} ->
 1231:             ?P("received passive message for socket (1) - "
 1232:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1233:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S1, [active]))
 1234:     after
 1235:         5000 ->
 1236:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (1)"),
 1237:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1238:     end,
 1239:     ?P("expect passive message for socket (2)"),
 1240:     receive
 1241:         {udp_passive,S2} ->
 1242:             ?P("received passive message for socket (2) - "
 1243:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1244:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S2, [active]))
 1245:     after
 1246:         5000 ->
 1247:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (2)"),
 1248:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1249:     end,
 1250: 
 1251:     ?P("create socket (3) with active = ~w and expect passive message", [0]),
 1252:     S3 = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1253:     receive
 1254:         {udp_passive,S3} ->
 1255:             ?P("received passive message for socket (3) - "
 1256:                "verify socket active passive (false)"),
 1257:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S3, [active]))
 1258:     after
 1259:         5000 ->
 1260:             ?P("ERROR: received nothing (3)"),
 1261:             exit({error,udp_passive})
 1262:     end,
 1263: 
 1264:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1265:     ok = gen_udp:close(S3),
 1266:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1267:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1268: 
 1269:     ?P("done"),
 1270:     ok.
 1271: 
 1272: 
 1273: 
 1274: recvtos(Config) ->
 1275:     test_recv_opts(
 1276:       Config,
 1277:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], false,
 1278:       fun recvtos_ok/2).
 1279: 
 1280: recvtosttl(Config) ->
 1281:     test_recv_opts(
 1282:       Config,
 1283:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1284:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1285:               recvtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso recvttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1286:       end).
 1287: 
 1288: recvttl(Config) ->
 1289:     test_recv_opts(
 1290:       Config,
 1291:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], false,
 1292:       fun recvttl_ok/2).
 1293: 
 1294: recvtclass(Config) ->
 1295:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1296:     case
 1297:         [Name ||
 1298:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1299:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1300:     of
 1301:         [_] ->
 1302:             test_recv_opts(
 1303:               Config,
 1304:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], false,
 1305:               fun recvtclass_ok/2);
 1306:         [] ->
 1307:             {skip,ipv6_not_supported,IFs}
 1308:     end.
 1309: 
 1310: 
 1311: sendtos(Config) ->
 1312:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtos(Config) end).
 1313: 
 1314: do_sendtos(Config) ->
 1315:     test_recv_opts(
 1316:       Config,
 1317:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96}], true,
 1318:       fun sendtos_ok/2).
 1319: 
 1320: sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1321:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtosttl(Config) end).
 1322: 
 1323: do_sendtosttl(Config) ->
 1324:     test_recv_opts(
 1325:       Config,
 1326:       inet, [{recvtos,tos,96},{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1327:       fun (OSType, OSVer) ->
 1328:               sendtos_ok(OSType, OSVer) andalso sendttl_ok(OSType, OSVer)
 1329:       end).
 1330: 
 1331: sendttl(Config) ->
 1332:     ?TC_TRY(sendttl, fun() -> do_sendttl(Config) end).
 1333: 
 1334: do_sendttl(Config) ->
 1335:     test_recv_opts(
 1336:       Config,
 1337:       inet, [{recvttl,ttl,33}], true,
 1338:       fun sendttl_ok/2).
 1339: 
 1340: sendtclass(Config) ->
 1341:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_sendtclass(Config) end).
 1342: 
 1343: do_sendtclass(Config) ->
 1344:     {ok,IFs} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 1345:     case
 1346:         [Name ||
 1347:             {Name,Opts} <- IFs,
 1348:             lists:member({addr,{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}}, Opts)]
 1349:     of
 1350:         [_] ->
 1351:             test_recv_opts(
 1352:               Config,
 1353:               inet6, [{recvtclass,tclass,224}], true,
 1354:               fun sendtclass_ok/2);
 1355:         [] ->
 1356:             {skip, {ipv6_not_supported, IFs}}
 1357:     end.
 1358: 
 1359: 
 1360: %% These version numbers are just above the highest noted in daily tests
 1361: %% where the test fails for a plausible reason, that is the lowest
 1362: %% where we can expect that the test might succeed, so
 1363: %% skip on platforms lower than this.
 1364: %%
 1365: %% On newer versions it might be fixed, but we'll see about that
 1366: %% when machines with newer versions gets installed...
 1367: %% If the test still fails for a plausible reason these
 1368: %% version numbers simply should be increased.
 1369: %% Or maybe we should change to only test on known good platforms?
 1370: 
 1371: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1372: recvtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {17,6,0});
 1373: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1374: recvtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1375: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1376: recvtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1377: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1378: recvtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1379: %%
 1380: recvtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1381: recvtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1382: 
 1383: %% Option has no effect
 1384: recvttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1385: %%
 1386: recvttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1387: recvttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1388: 
 1389: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1390: recvtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1391: recvtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1392: %% Option has no effect
 1393: recvtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1394: %%
 1395: recvtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1396: recvtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1397: 
 1398: 
 1399: %% To send ancillary data seems to require much higher version numbers
 1400: %% than receiving it...
 1401: %%
 1402: 
 1403: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1404: sendtos_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,0,0});
 1405: sendtos_ok({unix,netbsd}, _OSVer) -> false;
 1406: sendtos_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1407: sendtos_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1408: sendtos_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1409: sendtos_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1410: %%
 1411: sendtos_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1412: sendtos_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1413: 
 1414: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1415: sendttl_ok({unix,darwin}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {19,6,0});
 1416: sendttl_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {4,0,0});
 1417: %% Using the option returns enoprotoopt, so it is not implemented.
 1418: sendttl_ok({unix,freebsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {13,1,0});
 1419: %% Option has no effect
 1420: sendttl_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1421: sendttl_ok({unix,openbsd}, _OSVer) -> false; % not semver_lt(OSVer, {6,9,0});
 1422: %%
 1423: sendttl_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1424: sendttl_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1425: 
 1426: %% Using the option returns einval, so it is not implemented.
 1427: sendtclass_ok({unix,darwin}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {9,9,0});
 1428: sendtclass_ok({unix,linux}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {2,6,11});
 1429: %% Option has no effect
 1430: sendtclass_ok({unix,sunos}, OSVer) -> not semver_lt(OSVer, {5,12,0});
 1431: %%
 1432: sendtclass_ok({unix,_}, _) -> true;
 1433: sendtclass_ok(_, _) -> false.
 1434: 
 1435: 
 1436: semver_lt({X1,Y1,Z1} = V1, {X2,Y2,Z2} = V2) ->
 1437:     ?P("semver_lt -> OS version check:"
 1438:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1439:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1440:     if
 1441:         X1 > X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 > X2: ~p > ~p", [X1, X2]), false;
 1442:         X1 < X2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> X1 < X2: ~p < ~p", [X1, X2]), true;
 1443:         Y1 > Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 > Y2: ~p > ~p", [Y1, Y2]), false;
 1444:         Y1 < Y2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Y1 < Y2: ~p < ~p", [Y1, Y2]), true;
 1445:         Z1 > Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 > Z2: ~p > ~p", [Z1, Z2]), false;
 1446:         Z1 < Z2 -> ?P("semver_lt -> Z1 < Z2: ~p < ~p", [Z1, Z2]), true;
 1447:         true    -> ?P("semver_lt -> default"), false
 1448:     end;
 1449: semver_lt(V1, {_,_,_} = V2) ->
 1450:     ?P("semver_lt -> fallback OS version check when: "
 1451:        "~n   Version 1: ~p"
 1452:        "~n   Version 2: ~p", [V1, V2]),
 1453:     false.
 1454: 
 1455: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, OSFilter) ->
 1456:     OSType = os:type(),
 1457:     OSVer  = os:version(),
 1458:     case OSFilter(OSType, OSVer) of
 1459:         true ->
 1460:             ?P("OS: ~p, ~p", [OSType, OSVer]),
 1461:             test_recv_opts(Config,
 1462:                            Family, Spec, TestSend, OSType, OSVer);
 1463:         false ->
 1464:             {skip,{not_supported_for_os_version,{OSType,OSVer}}}
 1465:     end.
 1466: %%
 1467: test_recv_opts(Config, Family, Spec, TestSend, _OSType, _OSVer) ->
 1468:     Timeout = 5000,
 1469:     RecvOpts = [RecvOpt || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1470:     TrueRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,true} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1471:     FalseRecvOpts = [{RecvOpt,false} || {RecvOpt,_,_} <- Spec],
 1472:     Opts = [Opt || {_,Opt,_} <- Spec],
 1473:     OptsVals = [{Opt,Val} || {_,Opt,Val} <- Spec],
 1474:     TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals = TrueRecvOpts ++ OptsVals,
 1475:     Addr =
 1476:         case Family of
 1477:             inet ->
 1478:                 {127,0,0,1};
 1479:             inet6 ->
 1480:                 {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1}
 1481:         end,
 1482:     %%
 1483:     ?P("try open socket (1) with true opts"),
 1484:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,false}|TrueRecvOpts]),
 1485:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1486:     ?P("try get (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1487:     {ok, TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1488:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1489:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1490:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1491:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1492:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals),
 1493:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts_OptsVals} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1494:     %%
 1495:     %% S1 now has true receive options and set option values
 1496:     %%
 1497:     ?P("try open socket (2) with false opts"),
 1498:     {ok, S2} =
 1499:         ?OPEN(Config, 0, [Family, binary, {active,true} | FalseRecvOpts]),
 1500:     {ok, P2} = inet:port(S2),
 1501:     ?P("try get (false) socket (2) opts"),
 1502:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts ++ Opts),
 1503:     OptsVals2 = FalseRecvOpts_OptsVals2 -- FalseRecvOpts,
 1504:     ?P("info: "
 1505:        "~n   Socket 1:    ~p"
 1506:        "~n   Socket 2:    ~p"
 1507:        "~n   Opts Vals 2: ~p", [inet:info(S1), inet:info(S2), OptsVals2]),
 1508: 
 1509:     %%
 1510:     %% S2 now has false receive options and default option values,
 1511:     %% OptsVals2 contains the default option values
 1512:     %%
 1513:     ?P("send/3: S2 -> S1"),
 1514:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, <<"abcde">>),
 1515:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1516: 
 1517:     ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"),
 1518:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, Addr, P2, <<"fghij">>),
 1519:     TestSend andalso
 1520:         begin
 1521:             ?P("send/5: S2 -> S1"
 1522:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1523:             case gen_udp:send(S2, Addr, P1, OptsVals, <<"ABCDE">>) of
 1524:                 ok ->
 1525:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1526:                     ok;
 1527:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason1} ->
 1528:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (1) failed: ~p", [Reason1]))
 1529:             end,
 1530:             ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"
 1531:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1532:             case gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, OptsVals, <<"12345">>) of
 1533:                 ok ->
 1534:                     ?SLEEP(100),
 1535:                     ok;
 1536:                 {error, enoprotoopt = Reason2} ->
 1537:                     ?SKIPT(?F("send (2) failed: ~p", [Reason2]))
 1538:             end
 1539:         end,
 1540:     ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1541:     {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals3, <<"abcde">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1542:     ?P("S1 recv: "
 1543:        "~n   OptsVals3: ~p", [OptsVals3]),
 1544:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1545: 
 1546:     verify_sets_eq(OptsVals3, OptsVals2),
 1547:     TestSend andalso
 1548:         begin
 1549:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1550:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals0,<<"ABCDE">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1551:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1552:                "~n   OptsVals0: ~p", [OptsVals0]),
 1553:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1554: 
 1555:             ?P("try S1 recv"),
 1556:             {ok,{_,P2,OptsVals1,<<"12345">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1557:             ?P("S1 recv: "
 1558:                "~n   OptsVals1: ~p", [OptsVals1]),
 1559:             ?SLEEP(100),
 1560:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals0, OptsVals),
 1561:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals1, OptsVals)
 1562:         end,
 1563:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1564:     receive
 1565:         {udp, S2, _, P1, <<"fghij">>} ->
 1566:             ?P("S2 received message"),
 1567:             ok;
 1568:         Other1 ->
 1569:             exit({unexpected,Other1})
 1570:     after Timeout ->
 1571:             exit(timeout)
 1572:     end,
 1573:     %%
 1574:     ?P("try set (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1575:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, FalseRecvOpts),
 1576:     ?P("verify (false) socket (1) opts"),
 1577:     {ok, FalseRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S1, RecvOpts),
 1578:     ?P("try set (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1579:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, TrueRecvOpts),
 1580:     ?P("verify (true) socket (1) opts"),
 1581:     {ok,TrueRecvOpts} = inet:getopts(S2, RecvOpts),
 1582:     %%
 1583:     %% S1 now has false receive options and set option values
 1584:     %%
 1585:     %% S2 now has true receive options and default option values
 1586:     %%
 1587:     ?P("send/4: S2 -> S1"),
 1588:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, {Addr,P1}, [], <<"klmno">>),
 1589:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1590: 
 1591:     ?P("send/3: S1 -> S2"),
 1592:     ok = gen_udp:send(S1, {Family,{loopback,P2}}, <<"pqrst">>),
 1593:     ?SLEEP(100),
 1594: 
 1595:     TestSend andalso
 1596:         begin
 1597:             ?P("send/4: S1 -> S2"
 1598:                "~n   ~p", [OptsVals]),
 1599:             ok = gen_udp:send(S1,
 1600:                               {Family,{loopback,P2}}, OptsVals2, <<"PQRST">>),
 1601:             ?SLEEP(100)
 1602:         end,
 1603: 
 1604:     ?P("try recv data on S1"),
 1605:     {ok,{_,P2,<<"klmno">>}} = gen_udp:recv(S1, 0, Timeout),
 1606:     ?P("await message on S2"),
 1607:     receive
 1608:         {udp,S2,_,P1,OptsVals4,<<"pqrst">>} ->
 1609:             ?P("S2 message received: "
 1610:                "~n   OptsVals4: ~p", [OptsVals4]),
 1611:             verify_sets_eq(OptsVals4, OptsVals);
 1612:         Other2 ->
 1613:             exit({unexpected,Other2})
 1614:     after Timeout ->
 1615:             exit(timeout)
 1616:     end,
 1617:     ?P("(maybe, ~p) await message on S2", [TestSend]),
 1618:     TestSend andalso
 1619:         receive
 1620:             {udp, S2, _, P1, OptsVals5, <<"PQRST">>} ->
 1621:                 ?P("S2 message received: "
 1622:                    "~n   OptsVals5: ~p", [OptsVals5]),
 1623:                 verify_sets_eq(OptsVals5, OptsVals2);
 1624:             Other3 ->
 1625:                 exit({unexpected,Other3})
 1626:         after Timeout ->
 1627:                 exit(timeout)
 1628:         end,
 1629: 
 1630:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1631:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1632:     ok = gen_udp:close(S2),
 1633: %%%    exit({{_OSType,_OSVer},success}), % In search for the truth
 1634: 
 1635:     ?P("done"),
 1636:     ok.
 1637: 
 1638: verify_sets_eq(L1, L2) ->
 1639:     L = lists:sort(L1),
 1640:     case lists:sort(L2) of
 1641:         L ->
 1642:             ok;
 1643:         _ ->
 1644:             exit({sets_neq, L1, L2})
 1645:     end.
 1646: 
 1647: 
 1648: local_basic(Config) ->
 1649:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, []) end).
 1650: 
 1651: local_basic_binary(Config) ->
 1652:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_basic(Config, [binary]) end).
 1653: 
 1654: do_local_basic(Config, Opts) ->
 1655:     ?P("begin"),
 1656:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1657:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1658:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1659:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1660:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1661:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1662:     %%
 1663:     ?P("create server socket"),
 1664:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,SFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1665:     ?P("create client socket"),
 1666:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}|Opts])),
 1667:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1668:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1669:     ?P("SockName(s):"
 1670:        "~n   Server: ~p"
 1671:        "~n   Client: ~p", [SAddr, CAddr]),
 1672:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1673: 
 1674:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1675:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1676:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1677:     %%
 1678:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1679:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1680:     ?P("end"),
 1681:     ok.
 1682: 
 1683: local_unbound(Config) ->
 1684:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1685:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1686:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1687:     %%
 1688:     S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1689:     C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}])),
 1690:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1691:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1692:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1693:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1694:     %%
 1695:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1696:     ok.
 1697: 
 1698: local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1699:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen(Config) end).
 1700: 
 1701: 
 1702: do_local_fdopen(Config) ->
 1703:     ?P("begin"),
 1704:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1705:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1706:     CFile = local_filename(client),
 1707:     CAddr = {local,bin_filename(CFile)},
 1708:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1709:     _ = file:delete(CFile),
 1710: 
 1711:     %%
 1712:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (server) socket"),
 1713:     {S0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}]) of
 1714:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1715:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1716:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1717:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1718:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1719:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1720:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1721:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1722:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1723:                end,
 1724:     ?P("try create (client) socket"),
 1725:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,CFile}},{active,false}])),
 1726:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S0)),
 1727:     CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1728:     ?P("try create (server) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1729:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd, FD}, local, {active,false}])),
 1730:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1731: 
 1732:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1733:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1734: 
 1735:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1736:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1737:     ok = gen_udp:close(S0),
 1738:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1739:     %%
 1740:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1741:     ok = file:delete(CFile),
 1742:     ?P("done"),
 1743:     ok.
 1744: 
 1745: local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1746:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) end).
 1747: 
 1748: do_local_fdopen_unbound(Config) ->
 1749:     ?P("begin"),
 1750:     SFile = local_filename(server),
 1751:     SAddr = {local,bin_filename(SFile)},
 1752:     _ = file:delete(SFile),
 1753: 
 1754:     %%
 1755:     ?P("try create (server) socket"),
 1756:     S  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,SAddr},{active,false}])),
 1757:     ?P("try create \"dummy\" (client) socket"),
 1758:     {C0, FD} = case ?OPEN(Config, 0, [local,{active,false}]) of
 1759:                    {ok, Sock0} when is_port(Sock0) ->
 1760:                        ?P("(port) try extract FD"),
 1761:                        Fd = ok(prim_inet:getfd(Sock0)),
 1762:                        {Sock0, Fd};
 1763:                    {ok, Sock0} -> % socket
 1764:                        ?P("(socket) try extract FD"),
 1765:                        {ok, [{fd, Fd}]} =
 1766:                            gen_udp_socket:getopts(Sock0, [fd]),
 1767:                        {Sock0, Fd}
 1768:                end,
 1769:     SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1770:     ?P("try create (client) socket using fd = ~w", [FD]),
 1771:     C  = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{fd,Fd},local,{active,false}])),
 1772: 
 1773:     ?P("perform handshake"),
 1774:     local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, undefined),
 1775: 
 1776:     ?P("cleanup"),
 1777:     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1778:     ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1779:     ok = gen_udp:close(C0),
 1780:     %%
 1781:     ok = file:delete(SFile),
 1782: 
 1783:     ?P("done"),
 1784:     ok.
 1785: 
 1786: local_abstract(Config) ->
 1787:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, fun() -> do_local_abstract(Config) end).
 1788: 
 1789: do_local_abstract(Config) ->
 1790:     case os:type() of
 1791: 	{unix,linux} ->
 1792:             ?P("create server socket"),
 1793: 	    S = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1794:             ?P("create client socket"),
 1795: 	    C = ok(?OPEN(Config, 0, [{ifaddr,{local,<<>>}},{active,false}])),
 1796:             ?P("verify sockname(s)"),
 1797: 	    {local,_} = SAddr = ok(inet:sockname(S)),
 1798: 	    {local,_} = CAddr = ok(inet:sockname(C)),
 1799:             ?P("perform handshake"),
 1800: 	    local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr),
 1801:             ?P("cleanup"),
 1802: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1803: 	    ok = gen_udp:close(C),
 1804:             ?P("done"),
 1805: 	    ok;
 1806: 	_ ->
 1807: 	    {skip, "AF_LOCAL Abstract Addresses only supported on Linux"}
 1808:     end.
 1809: 
 1810: 
 1811: local_handshake(S, SAddr, C, CAddr) ->
 1812:     SData = "9876543210",
 1813:     CData = "0123456789",
 1814:     ?P("try (client) send"),
 1815:     ok = gen_udp:send(C, SAddr, 0, CData),
 1816:     ?P("try (server) recv"),
 1817:     CData1 = local_handshake_data(C, CData),
 1818:     case ok(gen_tcp:recv(S, 112)) of
 1819: 	{{unspec,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1820: 	    ok;
 1821: 	{{local,<<>>}, 0, CData1} when CAddr =:= undefined ->
 1822: 	    ok;
 1823: 	{CAddr, 0, CData1} when CAddr =/= undefined ->
 1824: 	    ok = gen_udp:send(S, CAddr, 0, SData),
 1825:             SData1 = local_handshake_data(S, SData),
 1826: 	    {SAddr, 0, SData1} = ok(gen_tcp:recv(C, 112)),
 1827: 	    ok
 1828: 
 1829:     end.
 1830: 
 1831: local_handshake_data(S, Data) when is_list(Data) ->
 1832:     case inet:getopts(S, [mode]) of
 1833:         {ok,[{mode,binary}]} ->
 1834:             list_to_binary(Data);
 1835:         {ok,[{mode,list}]} ->
 1836:             Data
 1837:     end.
 1838: 
 1839: 
 1840: %%-------------------------------------------------------------
 1841: %% Open a passive socket. Create a socket that reads from it.
 1842: %% Then close the socket.
 1843: recv_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1844:     ?P("begin"),
 1845:     {ok, Sock} = ?OPEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}]),
 1846:     RECV = fun() ->
 1847:                    ?P("try recv"),
 1848:                    Res = gen_udp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1849:                    ?P("recv res: ~p", [Res]),
 1850:                    exit(Res)
 1851:            end,
 1852:     ?P("spawn reader"),
 1853:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(RECV),
 1854:     receive
 1855:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PreReason} ->
 1856:             %% Make sure id does not die for some other reason...
 1857:             ct:fail("Unexpected pre close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1858:                           [Pid, PreReason])
 1859:     after 5000 -> % Just in case...
 1860:             ok
 1861:     end,
 1862:     ?P("close socket"),
 1863:     ok = gen_udp:close(Sock),
 1864:     ?P("await reader termination"),
 1865:     receive
 1866:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, {error, closed}} ->
 1867:             ?P("expected reader termination result"),
 1868:             ok;
 1869:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, PostReason} ->
 1870:             ?P("unexpected reader termination: ~p", [PostReason]),
 1871:             ct:fail("Unexpected post close from reader (~p): ~p",
 1872:                           [Pid, PostReason])
 1873:     after 5000 ->
 1874:             ?P("unexpected reader termination timeout"),
 1875:             demonitor(MRef, [flush]),
 1876:             exit(Pid, kill),
 1877:             ct:fail("Reader (~p) termination timeout", [Pid])
 1878:     end,
 1879:     ?P("done"),
 1880:     ok.
 1881: 
 1882: 
 1883: 
 1884: 
 1885: %% Test that connect/3 has effect.
 1886: connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1887:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1888:             %% *Currently* not implemented
 1889:             fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 1890:             fun() -> do_connect(Config) end).
 1891: 
 1892: do_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1893:     ?P("begin"),
 1894:     Addr = {127,0,0,1},
 1895:     ?P("try create first socket"),
 1896:     {ok, S1} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1897:     {ok, P1} = inet:port(S1),
 1898:     ?P("try create second socket"),
 1899:     {ok, S2} = ?OPEN(Config, 0),
 1900:     ?P("try set second socket active: false: "
 1901:        "~n   ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1902:     ok = inet:setopts(S2, [{active, false}]),
 1903:     ?P("try close first socket"),
 1904:     ok = gen_udp:close(S1),
 1905: 
 1906:     %% Test if this helps...
 1907:     ?P("sleep some"),
 1908:     ct:sleep({seconds, 5}),
 1909: 
 1910:     ?P("try some doomed connect targets: ~p", [P1]),
 1911:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, "", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1912:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1913:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, ".", ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1914:     {error, nxdomain} = gen_udp:connect(S2, '.', ?CLOSED_PORT),
 1915:     ?P("try connect second socket to: ~p, ~p", [Addr, P1]),
 1916:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S2, Addr, P1),
 1917:     ?P("try send on second socket"),
 1918:     ok = gen_udp:send(S2, <<16#deadbeef:32>>),
 1919:     ?P("try recv on second socket - expect failure when"
 1920:        "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [inet:info(S2)]),
 1921:     ok = case gen_udp:recv(S2, 0, 500) of
 1922: 	     {error, econnrefused = R} -> ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]), ok;
 1923: 	     {error, econnreset   = R} -> ?P("expected failure: ~w", [R]), ok;
 1924: 	     Other -> 
 1925:                  ?P("UNEXPECTED failure: ~p:"
 1926:                     "~n   ~p", [Other, inet:info(S2)]),
 1927:                  Other
 1928: 	 end,
 1929:     ?P("done"),
 1930:     ok.
 1931: 
 1932: 
 1933: 
 1934: reconnect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1935:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1936:             %% *Currently* not implemented
 1937:             fun() -> is_not_windows() end,
 1938:             fun () -> do_reconnect(Config) end).
 1939: 
 1940: do_reconnect(Config) ->
 1941:     LoopAddr = {127,0,0,1},
 1942:     XtrnAddr = {8,8,8,8},
 1943:     DestPort = 53,
 1944:     {S, Port} = open_port_0(Config, []),
 1945:     ?P("Socket: ~w", [S]),
 1946:     %% Connect to a loopback destination
 1947:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, LoopAddr, DestPort),
 1948:     {ok, {LoopAddr,DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 1949:     {ok, {LocalAddr,Port}} = inet:sockname(S),
 1950:     ?P("Socket addr: ~w", [LocalAddr]),
 1951:     %% Reconnect to external destination
 1952:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, XtrnAddr, DestPort),
 1953:     {ok, {XtrnAddr,DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 1954:     {ok, {RoutableAddr,Port}} = inet:sockname(S),
 1955:     %% We should have a non-loopback address here
 1956:     true = RoutableAddr =/= LocalAddr,
 1957:     %% Reconnect to loopback
 1958:     ok = gen_udp:connect(S, LoopAddr, DestPort),
 1959:     {ok, {LoopAddr,DestPort}} = inet:peername(S),
 1960:     {ok, {LocalAddr,Port}} = inet:sockname(S),
 1961:     ok = inet:close(S).
 1962: 
 1963: %% For Linux to keep the port when we reconnect;
 1964: %% we need to first bind to a specific port.
 1965: %% If we bind to port 0 and get an ephemeral port
 1966: %% it apparently can change when we reconnect to a different
 1967: %% destination depending on routing and interfaces.
 1968: %%
 1969: %% I consider this a workaround for a Linux bug,
 1970: %% ironically in a test case that tests
 1971: %% a workaround for another Linux bug (related)...
 1972: %%
 1973: open_port_0(Config, Opts) ->
 1974:     open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, 10).
 1975: %%
 1976: open_port_0(Config, Port, Opts, N) ->
 1977:     case ?OPEN(Config, Port, Opts) of
 1978:         {ok, S} ->
 1979:             if
 1980:                 Port =:= 0 ->
 1981:                     {ok, Port_1} = inet:port(S),
 1982:                     ok = gen_udp:close(S),
 1983:                     %% Speculate that we can open a socket with that port
 1984:                     open_port_0(Config, Port_1, Opts, N);
 1985:                 true ->
 1986:                     ?P("Socket port: ~w", [Port]),
 1987:                     {S, Port}
 1988:             end;
 1989:         {error, eaddrinuse} when Port =/= 0 ->
 1990:             open_port_0(Config, 0, Opts, N - 1);
 1991:         {error, _} = Error ->
 1992:             Error
 1993:     end.
 1994: 
 1995: 
 1996: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1997: 
 1998: implicit_inet6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1999:     ?TC_TRY(implicit_inet6, fun() -> do_implicit_inet6(Config) end).
 2000: 
 2001: do_implicit_inet6(Config) ->
